title.bibl: Sonntagpost (Sunday Edition of Abendpost), Oct. 21, 1934. Concert of the Columbia Ladies' Chorus

div.bibl: Sonntagpost (Sunday Edition of Abendpost), Oct. 21, 1934. CONCERT OF THE COLUMBIA LADIES' CHORUS

body.p: For the concert given this afternoon in Father Perez' clubhouse, 6710 South May Street, by the Columbia Ladies' Chorus, directed by Max Schuh, a varied program has been arranged, with the co-operation of many affiliated organizations and well-known soloists, and will please all tastes.

At the same time, care has been taken to give first-class hospitality to the guests, also for gay dance music for the ball which is to follow the concert. The program will begin at four o'clock in the afternoon, and the admission price is thirty-five cents per person.
The detailed program is as follows:
1. a) Hab' Sonne im Herzen..............Carl Schiebold,

b) Wer in des Anderen Augen liest......Carl Welhelm,
(Adapted for ladies' chorus by W. Schulz.)
Columbia Ladies' Chorus of the South Side.
b) Der Jaeger aus Kurpfalz(Folk song adapted by Wilh. Knoechel) Columbia Ladies' Chorus
4. Mutterliebe ................................................Voigt Vorwaerts Schiller Men's Chorus (Director: Wagner)
Soprano Solo, Frau Marie Schukert, (Member of the Columbia Ladies Chorus)
b) In Ruedesheim bei der Drosselgasse...........E. Kramer Men's Singing Club Erinnerung (Director: H. A. Rehberg)
b) At the Fountain...................................Davidoff Cello Solo: William Williams.
b) Guter Rat..........................................Rud. Wagner Chicago Ledertafel (Director: Wagner)
11. Nachtgesang im Walde..........................F. Schubert Columbia Ladies' Chorus
Amusing sketch with song, produced by the members of the Columbia Ladies' Chorus.
